symbols.name: abs
symbols.description: Absolute value

symbols.name: acos
symbols.description: arccosine function

symbols.name: add_menu_item
symbols.description: create a menu entry

symbols.name: add_text_line
symbols.description: add a new text line in the specified label without erasing existing text

symbols.name: allow_group
symbols.description: allows the specified group, i.e. makes it available for playback

symbols.name: array_equal
symbols.description:
checks the values of two arrays, true if all values are equal, false if
not

symbols.name: asin
symbols.description: arcsine (inverse sine function)

symbols.name: atan
symbols.description: arctangent (inverse tangent function)

symbols.name: attach_level_meter
symbols.description:
attach a level meter to a certain position within the instrument to read
volume data

symbols.name: attach_zone
symbols.description:
connects the corresponding zone to the waveform so that it shows up
within the display

symbols.name: by_marks
symbols.description: a user defined group of events (or event IDs)

symbols.name: by_track
symbols.description: can be used to group events by their track number

symbols.name: cbrt
symbols.description: Cube root function

symbols.name: cc_delivery_request
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: ceil
symbols.description: ceiling (round up) ceil(2.3) = 3.0

symbols.name: change_listener_par
symbols.description:
changes the parameters of the on listener callback. Can be used in every
callback.

symbols.name: change_note
symbols.description: change the note number of a specific note event

symbols.name: change_pan
symbols.description: change the pan position of a specific note event

symbols.name: change_time_with_pitch
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: change_tune
symbols.description: change the tuning of a specific note event in millicent

symbols.name: change_velo
symbols.description: change the velocity of a specific note event

symbols.name: change_vol
symbols.description: change the volume of a specific note event in millidecibel

symbols.name: cos
symbols.description: cosine function

symbols.name: dec
symbols.description: decrement an expression by 1 (x - 1)

symbols.name: delete_event_mark
symbols.description:
delete an event mark, i.e. ungroup the specified event from an event
group

symbols.name: detect_drum_type
symbols.description:
Assigns a $NI_DETECT_DRUM_TYPE tag describing
the drum type of an audio sample.

symbols.name: detect_instrument_type
symbols.description:
Assigns a $NI_DETECT_INSTRUMENT_TYPE tag
describing the in- strument type of an audio sample.

symbols.name: detect_key
symbols.description:
Assigns a $NI_DETECT_KEY tag describing the musical
key of the audio sample. If detection fails, the function will return
$NI_DETECT_KEY_INVALID.

symbols.name: detect_loudness
symbols.description: Returns a real value representing the loudness of an audio sample in dB.

symbols.name: detect_peak
symbols.description: Returns a real value representing peak level of an audio sample in dB.

symbols.name: detect_pitch
symbols.description:
Returns a real value representing the fundamental frequency of an audio
sample, in semi- tones and cents

symbols.name: detect_rms
symbols.description:
Returns a real value representing the RMS level of an audio sample in
dB.

symbols.name: detect_sample_type
symbols.description:
Assigns a $NI_DETECT_SAMPLE_TYPE tag
describing the whether an audio sample is a drum or an instrument.

symbols.name: detect_tempo
symbols.description:
Returns a real value representing the detected tempo of the audio sample,
in BPM. If detection fails, the function will return
~NI_DETECT_TEMPO_INVALID.

symbols.name: disable_logging
symbols.description:
Quickly disabling emission of messages, warnings or watched
variable
events to both the Kontakt Status Bar
$NI_LOG_MESSAGE, $NI_LOG_WARNING, $NI_LOG_WATCHING

symbols.name: disallow_group
symbols.description: disallows the specified group, i.e. makes it unavailable for playback

symbols.name: dont_use_machine_mode
symbols.description: play the specified event in sampler mode

symbols.name: event_status
symbols.description:
retrieve the status of a particular note event (or MIDI event in the
multi script)

symbols.name: exit
symbols.description: immediately stops a callback or exits a function

symbols.name: exp
symbols.description: exponential function (returns the value of e^x)

symbols.name: fade_in
symbols.description: perform a fade-in for a specific note event

symbols.name: fade_out
symbols.description: perform a fade-out for a specific note event

symbols.name: find_group
symbols.description: returns the group index for the specified group name

symbols.name: find_mod
symbols.description:
returns the slot index of an internal modulator or external modulation
slot

symbols.name: find_target
symbols.description: returns the slot index of a modulation slot of an internal modulator

symbols.name: find_zone
symbols.description:
returns the zone ID for the specified zone name. Only availabe in the
init callback.

symbols.name: floor
symbols.description: floor (round down) floor(2.8) = 2.0

symbols.name: fs_get_filename
symbols.description: return the filename of the last selected file in the UI file browser.

symbols.name: fs_navigate
symbols.description:
jump to the next/previous file in an ui file selector and trigger its
callback.

symbols.name: get_control_par
symbols.description: retrieve various parameters of the specified gui control

symbols.name: get_control_par_arr
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: get_control_par_real_arr
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: get_control_par_str
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: get_control_par_str_arr
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: get_engine_par
symbols.description: returns the value of a specific engine parameter

symbols.name: get_engine_par_disp
symbols.description: returns the displayed string of a specific engine parameter

symbols.name: get_engine_par_disp_m
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: get_engine_par_m
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: get_event_ids
symbols.description: fills the specified array with all active event IDs.

symbols.name: get_event_mark
symbols.description:
Check if the specified event belongs to a specific event group (returns 1
if the bitmark is set, 0 otherwise)

symbols.name: get_event_par
symbols.description: return the value of a specific event parameter of the specified event

symbols.name: get_event_par_arr
symbols.description:
special form of get_event_par(), used to retrieve the group allow state
of the specified event

symbols.name: get_folder
symbols.description: returns the path specified with the built-in path variable

symbols.name: get_font_id
symbols.description: Enables use of custom dynamic fonts

symbols.name: get_group_idx
symbols.description: returns the group index for the specified group name

symbols.name: get_key_color
symbols.description: returns the color constant of the specified note number

symbols.name: get_key_name
symbols.description: returns the name of the specified key

symbols.name: get_key_triggerstate
symbols.description:
returns the pressed state of the specified note number (i.e. key) on the
KONTAKT keyboard, can be either 1 (key pressed) or 0 (key released)

symbols.name: get_key_type
symbols.description: returns the key type constant of the specified key.

symbols.name: get_keyrange_max_note
symbols.description: returns the highest note of the specified key range

symbols.name: get_keyrange_min_note
symbols.description: returns the lowest note of the specified key range

symbols.name: get_keyrange_name
symbols.description: returns the name of the specified key range

symbols.name: get_loop_par
symbols.description: Returns the loop parameters of a zone

symbols.name: get_loop_sample
symbols.description: Returns paths, file names and extensions of samples

symbols.name: get_menu_item_str
symbols.description: returns the string value of the menu's entry.

symbols.name: get_menu_item_value
symbols.description: returns the value of the menu's entry.

symbols.name: get_menu_item_visibility
symbols.description: returns 1 if the menu entry is visible, otherwise 0.

symbols.name: get_mod_idx
symbols.description:
Returns the slot index of an internal modulator or external modulation
slot

symbols.name: get_num_zones
symbols.description:
Returns the total number of all zones that are present in the instrument
(regular and user zones)

symbols.name: get_purge_state
symbols.description: returns the purge state of the specified group. 0=purged, 1=not purged

symbols.name: get_sample_length
symbols.description: returns the length of the specified zone's sample in microseconds

symbols.name: get_sel_zones_idx
symbols.description:
Fills the specified array with indices of all selected zones in KONTAKT's
Mapping Editor.

symbols.name: get_target_idx
symbols.description: Returns the modulation target slot index of an internal modulator

symbols.name: get_ui_id
symbols.description: retrieve the ID number of an ui control

symbols.name: get_ui_wf_property
symbols.description: returns the value of the waveform's different properties.

symbols.name: get_voice_limit
symbols.description:
retunrs the voice limit for the Time Machine Pro mode of the source
module

symbols.name: get_zone_id
symbols.description: Returns the ID of the zone with the specified zone index

symbols.name: get_zone_par
symbols.description: Returns the zone parameters

symbols.name: get_zone_status
symbols.description:
Queries the status of the zone ID in
question. Zone status has four possible states:
- $NI_ZONE_STATUS_EMPTY - zone is a user zone and has no sample
loaded
- $NI_ZONE_STATUS_LOADED - zone is a user zone and has a sample
loaded
- $NI_ZONE_STATUS_PURGED - zone is purged from memory (valid for both
regular and user
zones)
- $NI_ZONE_STATUS_IGNORED - zone is ignored by the user response in the
Content Missing
dialog (valid for both regular and user zones)

symbols.name: group_name
symbols.description: returns the group name for the specified group

symbols.name: hide_part
symbols.description: hide specific parts of user interface controls

symbols.name: ignore_controller
symbols.description: ignore a controller event in a controller callback

symbols.name: ignore_event
symbols.description: ignore a note event in a note on or note off callback

symbols.name: ignore_midi
symbols.description:
Like ignore_event(), ignore_midi is a very "strong" command.
Keep in mind that ignore_midi will ignore all incoming MIDI events. If you
simply want to change the MIDI channel and/or any of the MIDI bytes, you can
also use set_event_par().

symbols.name: in_range
symbols.description: Boolean Operator: true if x is between y and z

symbols.name: inc
symbols.description: increment an expression by 1 (x + 1)

symbols.name: int
symbols.description: converts an integer value into a real number

symbols.name: int_to_real
symbols.description: converts an integer value into a real number

symbols.name: is_zone_empty
symbols.description: Returns 1 if a zone is empty (has no sample), otherwise returns 0

symbols.name: load_array
symbols.description: loads an array from an external file (.nka file)

symbols.name: load_array_str
symbols.description:
loads an array from an external file (.nka file) using the file's
absolute path

symbols.name: load_ir_sample
symbols.description: loads an impulse response sample into KONTAKT's convolution effect

symbols.name: load_ir_sample_m
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: load_midi_file
symbols.description: Load MIDI file from path (*Non documented)

symbols.name: load_patch
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: load_performance_view
symbols.description:
Loads a performance view file (NCKP) that was created in the Creator
Tools GUI Designer . The filename of the NCKP file, without
extension, as a string (in quotation marks)

symbols.name: log
symbols.description: logarithmic function

symbols.name: lsb
symbols.description: return the LSB portion (least significant byte) of a 14 bit value

symbols.name: make_instr_persistent
symbols.description: retain the value of a variable only with the instrument

symbols.name: make_perfview
symbols.description: activates the performance view for the respective script

symbols.name: make_persistent
symbols.description: retain the value of a variable whith the instrument and snapshot

symbols.name: message
symbols.description: display text in the status line of KONTAKT

symbols.name: mf_copy_export_area
symbols.description: Copies the content of MIDI export area 0 to the specified index.

symbols.name: mf_get_buffer_size
symbols.description: returns the size of the MIDI event buffer

symbols.name: mf_get_byte_one
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_get_byte_two
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_get_channel
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_get_command
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_get_event_par
symbols.description: returns the value of an event parameter

symbols.name: mf_get_first
symbols.description: moves the position marker to the first event in the MIDI track

symbols.name: mf_get_id
symbols.description:
returns the ID of the currently selected event (when using the navigation
commands like mf_get_first(), and mf_get_next(), etc)

symbols.name: mf_get_last
symbols.description: moves the position marker to the last event in the MIDI track

symbols.name: mf_get_last_filename
symbols.description:
Returns the filename (not the full path!) of the last MIDI file that was
inserted into KONTAKT, either via mf_insert_file(), or via drag and drop
operation on ui_mouse_area.

symbols.name: mf_get_mark
symbols.description:
checks if an event is marked or not. Returns 1 if it is marked, or 0 if
it is not.

symbols.name: mf_get_next
symbols.description: moves the position marker to the next event in the MIDI track

symbols.name: mf_get_next_at
symbols.description:
moves the position marker to the next event in the MIDI track right after
the defined position.

symbols.name: mf_get_note_length
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_get_num_tracks
symbols.description: returns the number of tracks in a MIDI object.

symbols.name: mf_get_pos
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_get_prev
symbols.description: moves the position marker to the previous event in the MIDI track

symbols.name: mf_get_prev_at
symbols.description: moves the position marker to the first event before the defined position

symbols.name: mf_get_track_idx
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_insert_event
symbols.description:
activates an inactive MIDI event in the MIDI object. However, because the
command and position are defined in this command, it can be considered as an
insertion.

symbols.name: mf_insert_file
symbols.description: inserts a MIDI file into the MIDI object.

symbols.name: mf_remove_event
symbols.description: deactivates an event in the MIDI object, effectively removing it

symbols.name: mf_reset
symbols.description:
resets the MIDI object, sets the event buffer to zero, and removes all
events

symbols.name: mf_set_buffer_size
symbols.description:
defines a number of inactive MIDI events, that can be activated and
edited

symbols.name: mf_set_byte_one
symbols.description: Non documented

symbols.name: mf_set_byte_two
symbols.description: Non documented

symbols.name: mf_set_channel
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: mf_set_command
symbols.description: Non documented

symbols.name: mf_set_event_par
symbols.description: sets an event parameter

symbols.name: mf_set_export_area
symbols.description:
defines the part of the MIDI object that will be exported when using a
drag and drop area, or the save_midi_file() command.

symbols.name: mf_set_mark
symbols.description:
marks an event, so that you may groups events together and process that
group quickly

symbols.name: mf_set_num_export_areas
symbols.description: Sets the number of export areas, with a maximum of 512.

symbols.name: mf_set_pos
symbols.description: Non documented

symbols.name: move_control
symbols.description: position ui elements in the standard KONTAKT grid

symbols.name: move_control_px
symbols.description: position ui elements in pixels

symbols.name: ms_to_ticks
symbols.description: converts a microseconds value into a tempo dependent ticks value

symbols.name: msb
symbols.description: return the MSB portion (most significant byte) of a 14 bit value

symbols.name: note_off
symbols.description: send a note off message to a specific note

symbols.name: num_elements
symbols.description: returns the number of elements in an array

symbols.name: num_slices
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: num_slices_zone
symbols.description: returns the number of slices of the specified zone

symbols.name: output_channel_name
symbols.description: returns the channel name for the specified output

symbols.name: pgs_create_key
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_create_str_key
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_get_key_val
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_get_str_key_val
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_key_exists
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_set_key_val
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_set_str_key_val
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: pgs_str_key_exists
symbols.description:
It is possible to send and receive values from one script to another,
discarding the usual left-to-right order by using the Program Global Storage
(PGS) commands. PGS is a dynamic memory that can be read/written by any
script.

symbols.name: play_note
symbols.description:
generate a MIDI note, i.e. generate a note on message followed by a note
off message

symbols.name: pow
symbols.description: power (returns the value of x^y)

symbols.name: purge_group
symbols.description: purges (i.e. unloads from RAM) the samples of the specified group

symbols.name: random
symbols.description: generate a random integer in the range <min> to <max>

symbols.name: read_persistent_var
symbols.description:
instantly reloads the value of a variable that was saved via the
make_persistent()command

symbols.name: real
symbols.description: converts a real number into an integer

symbols.name: real_to_int
symbols.description: converts a real number into an integer

symbols.name: redirect_midi
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: redirect_output
symbols.description:
Routes the audio signal of the specified event to a specific output or
bus

symbols.name: remove_keyrange
symbols.description: assigns a text string to the specified range of keys

symbols.name: reset_engine
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: reset_ksp_timer
symbols.description: resets the KSP timer ($KSP_TIMER) to zero

symbols.name: reset_rls_trig_counter
symbols.description:
dresets the release trigger counter (used by the release trigger system
script)

symbols.name: round
symbols.description: round (round to nearest) round(2.3) = 2.0 round(2.8) = 3.0

symbols.name: save_array
symbols.description: saves an array to an external file (i.e. an .nka file)

symbols.name: save_array_str
symbols.description:
saves an array to an external file (i.e. an .nka file), using the
specified absolute path

symbols.name: save_midi_file
symbols.description:
saves a MIDI file with a range specified by the mf_set_export_area()
command.

symbols.name: search
symbols.description:
searches the specified array for the specified value and returns the
index of its first position.

symbols.name: set_control_help
symbols.description:
assigns a text string to be displayed when hovering the ui control. The
text will appear in KONTAKT's info pane.

symbols.name: set_control_par
symbols.description: change various parameters of the specified gui control

symbols.name: set_control_par_arr
symbols.description:
change various parameters of an element within an array based gui control
(for example: cursors in the XY pad)

symbols.name: set_control_par_real_arr
symbols.description:
change various parameters of an element within an array-based UI widget,
e.g. ui_xy cursors.

symbols.name: set_control_par_str
symbols.description:
A variation of the command for usage with text strings. ( see:
set_control_par() Remarks)

symbols.name: set_control_par_str_arr
symbols.description:
A variation of the command for usage with text strings. ( see:
set_control_par_arr() Remarks)

symbols.name: set_controller
symbols.description: send a MIDI CC, pitchbend or channel pressure value

symbols.name: set_engine_par
symbols.description: control automatable KONTAKT parameters and bypass buttons

symbols.name: set_engine_par_m
symbols.description: Undocumented

symbols.name: set_event_mark
symbols.description: Assign the specified event to a specific event group

symbols.name: set_event_par
symbols.description: assign a parameter to a specific event

symbols.name: set_event_par_arr
symbols.description:
special form of set_event_par(), used to set the group allow state of the
specified event

symbols.name: set_key_color
symbols.description:
sets the color of the specified key (i.e. MIDI note) on the KONTAKT
keyboard. use $KEY_COLOR_****

symbols.name: set_key_name
symbols.description: assigns a text string to the specified key

symbols.name: set_key_pressed
symbols.description:
sets the trigger state of the specified key on KONTAKT's keyboard either
to pressed/on (1) or released/off (0)

symbols.name: set_key_pressed_support
symbols.description:
sets the pressed state support mode for KONTAKT'S keyboard. The available
modes are:
0: KONTAKT handles all pressed states, set_key_pressed() commands are
ignored (default mode)
1: KONTAKT's keyboard is only affected by set_key_pressed() commands

symbols.name: set_key_type
symbols.description:
assigns a key type to the specified key.
The following key types are available:
$NI_KEY_TYPE_DEFAULT (i.e. normal mapped notes that produce sound)
$NI_KEY_TYPE_CONTROL (i.e. key switches or other notes that do not produce
sound)
$NI_KEY_TYPE_NONE (resets the key to its normal KONTAKT behaviour)

symbols.name: set_keyrange
symbols.description: assigns a text string to the specified range of keys.

symbols.name: set_knob_defval
symbols.description:
assign a default value to a knob to which the knob is reset when
Cmd-clicking (mac) or Ctrl-clicking (PC) the knob.

symbols.name: set_knob_label
symbols.description: assign a text string to a knob

symbols.name: set_knob_unit
symbols.description: assign a unit mark to a knob.

symbols.name: set_listener
symbols.description:
Sets the signals on which the listener callback should react to. Can only
be used in the init callback.

symbols.name: set_loop_par
symbols.description: Sets the loop parameters of a user zone

symbols.name: set_map_editor_event_color
symbols.description:
Assigns the specified color to events generated in the current script
slot, visible in KONTAKT's Mapping Editor.

symbols.name: set_menu_item_str
symbols.description: sets the value of a menu entry.

symbols.name: set_menu_item_value
symbols.description: sets the value of a menu entry.

symbols.name: set_menu_item_visibility
symbols.description: sets the visibility of a menu entry.

symbols.name: set_midi
symbols.description:
create any type of MIDI event. If you simply want to change the MIDI
channel and/or any of the MIDI bytes, you can also use set_event_par().

symbols.name: set_note_controller
symbols.description:
Sends a MIDI 2.0 Registered Per-Note Controller, MIDI 2.0 Assignable
Per-Note Controller or MIDI 2.0 Per-Note Pitch Bend message.

symbols.name: set_nrpn
symbols.description: send a nrpn message

symbols.name: set_num_user_zones
symbols.description: Creates empty user zones

symbols.name: set_poly_at
symbols.description: Sends a MIDI Polyphonic Aftertouch message.

symbols.name: set_rpn
symbols.description: send a rpn message

symbols.name: set_sample
symbols.description: Sets the user sample in a zone

symbols.name: set_script_title
symbols.description: set the script title

symbols.name: set_skin_offset
symbols.description:
offsets the chosen background picture file by the specified number of
pixels

symbols.name: set_snapshot_type
symbols.description:
configures the KSP processor behavior of all five slots when a snapshot
is recalled

symbols.name: set_table_steps_shown
symbols.description: changes the number of displayed columns in an ui table

symbols.name: set_text
symbols.description:
when applied to a label: delete the text currently visible in the
specified label and add new text.
when applied to knobs, buttons, switches and value edits: set the display
name of the ui element.

symbols.name: set_ui_color
symbols.description: set the main background color of the performance view

symbols.name: set_ui_height
symbols.description: set the height of a script performance view in grid units

symbols.name: set_ui_height_px
symbols.description: set the height of a script performance view in pixels

symbols.name: set_ui_wf_property
symbols.description: sets different properties for the waveform control

symbols.name: set_ui_width_px
symbols.description: set the width of a script performance view in pixels

symbols.name: set_voice_limit

Signum function (returns -1 if the number is negative, 0 if it's zero, 1
if it's positive)

shifts the bits in by the amount of

shifts the bits in by the amount of
to the right

waits until the async command identified by the is

symbols.name: zone_slice_idx_loop_end
symbols.description: returns the index number of the slice at the loop end

symbols.name: zone_slice_idx_loop_start
symbols.description: returns the index number of the slice at the loop start

symbols.name: zone_slice_length
symbols.description:
returns the length in microseconds of the specified slice with respect to
the current tempo

symbols.name: zone_slice_loop_count
symbols.description: returns the loop count of the specified loop

symbols.name: zone_slice_start
symbols.description:
returns the absolute start point of the specified slice in microseconds,
independent of the current tempo
